qas.question: What country was in control of Samoa up until 1962?
During what years was the Samoan influenza epidemic?
What official organization was responsible for Samoa during most of the 20th century?
What new label did the Department of External Affairs receive in 1943?
About how much of the total population of Samoa died from influenza during the epidemic?

plausible_answers.text: From the end of World War I until 1962

qas.question: For how long did the UN control Samoa?
How much of the New Zeland population died from the flu from 1918-1919?
What organization was responsible for governing New Zeland from 1919-1962?
What was the new name of the Department of External Affairs in 1918?

plausible_answers.text: as a Class C Mandate under trusteeship

qas.question: How was New Zeland classified when under the League of Nations and the UN?

context: <b5_0>From the end of World War I until 1962<b5_0/>, <a0_0>New Zealand<a0_0/> controlled Samoa <b9_0>as a Class C Mandate under trusteeship<b9_0/> through the League of Nations, then through the United Nations. There followed a series of New Zealand administrators who were responsible for two major incidents. In the first incident, <b6_0>approximately <a4_0>one fifth<b6_0/><a4_0/> of the Samoan population died in the influenza epidemic of <a1_0>1918–1919<a1_0/>. Between 1919 and 1962, Samoa was administered by <a2_0><b7_0>the Department of External Affairs<b7_0/><a2_0/>, a government department which had been specially created to oversee New Zealand's Island Territories and Samoa. In 1943, this Department was renamed <b8_0>the <a3_0>Department of Island Territories<b8_0/><a3_0/> after a separate Department of External Affairs was created to conduct New Zealand's foreign affairs.
